    Compare with Benchmarks Compare Means

    Compare Means

    compare_means.Rmd

    Compare Means Within Groups

    This uses a paired t-test.

    # Example data
data <- data.frame(id = c(1:7),
           task1 = c(4, 1, 2, 3, 8, 4, 4),
           task2 = c(7, 13, 9, 7, 18, 8, 10))

data 
  id task1 task2
1  1     4     7
2  2     1    13
3  3     2     9
4  4     3     7
5  5     8    18
6  6     4     8
7  7     4    10
    compare_means_within_groups(data$task1, data$task2)
    ── Compare Means Within Groups ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
  X.                result.estimate  
  mean.difference         -6.571429  
  t                           -5.18  
  p                           0.002  
  df                              6  
  ci_level                     0.95  
  lower_ci                    -9.68  
  upper_ci                    -3.46

    Compare Means Between Groups 

    # Example data
set.seed(1)
data <- data.frame(x = c(rnorm(1:30)), y = c(rnorm(1:30)))

head(data)
           x           y
1 -0.6264538  1.35867955
2  0.1836433 -0.10278773
3 -0.8356286  0.38767161
4  1.5952808 -0.05380504
5  0.3295078 -1.37705956
6 -0.8204684 -0.41499456

    Student’s Test 

    compare_means_between_groups(data$x, data$y, equal_variances = TRUE)
    ──  Two Sample t-test ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
  X.           result.estimate  
  x                  0.1616584  
  y                  0.1134107  
  t                       0.17  
  p                      0.867  
  df                        58  
  ci_level                0.95  
  lower_ci               -0.53  
  upper_ci                0.62

    Welsch Test 

    compare_means_between_groups(data$x, data$y, equal_variances = FALSE)
    ── Welch Two Sample t-test ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
  X.           result.estimate  
  x                  0.1616584  
  y                  0.1134107  
  t                       0.17  
  p                      0.867  
  df                        55  
  ci_level                0.95  
  lower_ci               -0.53  
  upper_ci                0.62
